issue.title: Refactor Watchdog Base Architecture
issue.body:
Align watchdog base with browser session lifecycle.

**Tasks:**
- Move watchdog base to browser module
- Update initialization flow

issue.body:
Support browser profiles with persistent state.

**Location:** `src/heimdall/browser/`

**Tasks:**
- Create `BrowserProfile` class
- Support persistent cookies and proxy settings

issue.body:
Support multiple browser sessions for complex workflows.

**Location:** `src/heimdall/browser/`

**Tasks:**
- Create `SessionManager` class
- Support named sessions and switching

issue.body:
Auto-detect variables from page content.

**Location:** `src/heimdall/agent/`

**Tasks:**
- Create `VariableDetector` class
- Detect URLs, emails, prices etc.

Improve iframe handling including cross-origin frames.

**Location:** `src/heimdall/dom/service.py`

**Tasks:**
- Add `cross_origin_iframes` config option
- Implement recursive frame traversal
- Add iframe depth/count limits

Detect pagination elements for multi-page data extraction.

**Tasks:**
- Add `detect_pagination_buttons()` method
- Return structured pagination info

issue.body:
Securely handle passwords and API keys.

**Tasks:**

- Mask values in logs

issue.body:
Support clicking by viewport coordinates.

**Tasks:**

- Implement coordinate conversion

issue.title: Enhance Dropdown Handling
issue.body:
Improve dropdown/select element handling.

**Location:** `src/heimdall/tools/actions.py`

**Tasks:**
- Add `get_dropdown_options` action
- Support ARIA menus and custom dropdowns

issue.title: Implement Content Extraction Action
issue.body:
Add LLM-powered content extraction for structured data retrieval.

**Location:** `src/heimdall/tools/actions.py`

**Tasks:**
- Add `extract` action using LLM
- Support custom extraction schemas

issue.title: Implement Tab Management Actions
issue.body:
Add browser tab management capabilities.

**Location:** `src/heimdall/tools/actions.py`, `src/heimdall/browser/session.py`

**Tasks:**
- Add `switch_tab`, `close_tab`, `new_tab` actions
- Track tab state in `BrowserSession`

issue.body:

- Call highlight/tooltip methods before actions

issue.body:
Integrate the collector module into agent execution for step capture and export.

**Location:** `src/heimdall/collector/` â†’ `src/heimdall/cli.py`

**Tasks:**
- Hook collector into agent loop for before/after step capture
- Export results at task completion

issue.title: Integrate Watchdogs into Agent Loop
issue.body:
Wire existing watchdog implementations into the agent execution loop.

**Location:** `src/heimdall/watchdogs/` â†’ `src/heimdall/agent/loop.py`

**Tasks:**
- Start watchdogs in `Agent.run()`
- Subscribe agent loop to watchdog events
- Use navigation/network events for smarter waiting

issue.title: feat(macos-app): add custom namespace UI for cluster isolation
issue.body:
## Overview

Add Advanced Options section with custom namespace field that allows users to override EXO_LIBP2P_NAMESPACE environment variable. This enables splitting machines that can see each other into separate clusters.

- Added customNamespace property with UserDefaults persistence
- Added Advanced Options collapsible section with text field
- Added Save & Restart button that auto-restarts exo process
- Namespace replaces buildTag when custom value is set
- Falls back to buildTag (version) when namespace is empty

## Motivation

EXO supports multiple p2p namespaces to split up clusters via the `EXO_LIBP2P_NAMESPACE` environment variable when building from source. However, when using the macOS app, this was hardcoded to the application version, making it impossible for users to isolate machines into separate clusters without rebuilding the app.

This PR adds a UI option in the macOS app to set a custom namespace, allowing users to split machines that can see each other into multiple logical clusters.

## Changes

- Added `customNamespace` property to [ExoProcessController.swift](cci:7://file:///exo/app/EXO/EXO/ExoProcessController.swift:0:0-0:0) with UserDefaults persistence
- Added "Advanced Options" collapsible section to [ContentView.swift](cci:7://file:///exo/app/EXO/EXO/ContentView.swift:0:0-0:0) (similar to existing Debug Info section)
- Added text field for entering custom namespace with "Save & Restart" button
- Modified `computeNamespace()` to use custom namespace when set, falling back to buildTag (app version) when empty
- Button is disabled when no changes are pending
- Automatically restarts exo process when namespace is saved (if running)

## Why It Works

The implementation modifies the `makeEnvironment()` function to set `EXO_LIBP2P_NAMESPACE` using the custom value from UserDefaults. When the namespace is changed and saved:

1. User enters namespace in text field (value stored in local state)
2. Clicking "Save & Restart" writes to UserDefaults and calls `controller.restart()`
3. On next launch, `computeNamespace()` returns the custom value instead of buildTag
4. This namespace is used when creating the exo process, isolating it from other clusters

## Test Plan

### Manual Testing
**Hardware:** MacBook Air M1 8GB (macOS 26.02)

**What I tested:**
- Verified namespace field appears in Advanced Options section
- Tested entering custom namespace (e.g., "my-cluster")
- Confirmed "Save & Restart" button restarts exo process
- Verified namespace persists across app restarts (UserDefaults)
- Tested empty namespace falls back to buildTag (app version)
- Confirmed button is disabled when no changes pending

### Automated Testing
No automated tests added.

issue.title: [EASY] Add UI option to pass through custom `EXO_LIBP2P_NAMESPACE` from Swift
issue.body:
EXO supports multiple p2p namespaces to split up clusters. This is usable when building from source by providing the `EXO_LIBP2P_NAMESPACE` environment variable when running from source, but when using the macOS app this is hardcoded to the application version.

Add an option in the macOS UI to extend this variable with a custom parameter. This will allow splitting machines that can see each other into multiple clusters.

issue.title: fix(openai): cache httpx clients in AzureChatOpenAI

labels.name: integration
labels.description: PR made that is related to a provider partner package integration

labels.name: fix
labels.description: For PRs that implement a fix

issue.body:
## Description

Fixes #32489

[AzureChatOpenAI](cci:2://file:///Users/black/Documents/repo/langchain/libs/partners/openai/langchain_openai/chat_models/azure.py:33:0-1163:9) was creating new `httpx.Client` and `httpx.AsyncClient` instances on each instantiation, leading to resource inefficiency. This aligns [AzureChatOpenAI](cci:2://file:///Users/black/Documents/repo/langchain/libs/partners/openai/langchain_openai/chat_models/azure.py:33:0-1163:9) with the existing behavior in [BaseChatOpenAI](cci:2://file:///Users/black/Documents/repo/langchain/libs/partners/openai/langchain_openai/chat_models/base.py:487:0-2210:9).

## Changes

1. Import cached httpx client helper functions from [_client_utils.py](cci:7://file:///Users/black/Documents/repo/langchain/libs/partners/openai/langchain_openai/chat_models/_client_utils.py:0:0-0:0)
2. Use [_get_default_httpx_client()](cci:1://file:///Users/black/Documents/repo/langchain/libs/partners/openai/langchain_openai/chat_models/_client_utils.py:84:0-96:59) and [_get_default_async_httpx_client()](cci:1://file:///Users/black/Documents/repo/langchain/libs/partners/openai/langchain_openai/chat_models/_client_utils.py:99:0-111:60) when no custom http client is provided
3. Add credential check before client creation (matching [BaseChatOpenAI](cci:2://file:///Users/black/Documents/repo/langchain/libs/partners/openai/langchain_openai/chat_models/base.py:487:0-2210:9) behavior) - defers credential errors to invocation time

## Performance Impact

- **Before**: 5 [AzureChatOpenAI](cci:2://file:///Users/black/Documents/repo/langchain/libs/partners/openai/langchain_openai/chat_models/azure.py:33:0-1163:9) instances = 5 sync + 5 async httpx clients created
- **After**: 5 [AzureChatOpenAI](cci:2://file:///Users/black/Documents/repo/langchain/libs/partners/openai/langchain_openai/chat_models/azure.py:33:0-1163:9) instances = 1 sync + 1 async httpx client (cached and reused)

## Testing

- All 9 existing unit tests pass

issue.title: Embedding models not showing up in "My Models" until an LLM is downloaded
issue.body: Hi there! I would like to point out an apparently inconsistent behaviour on LM Studio (macOS, v. 0.3.36 build 1). I have downloaded an embedding model (`Qwen/Qwen3-Embedding-4B-GGUF`). Everything's fine, download is fine, the model is currently visible in the `.lmstudio/models` folder but the GUI shows the following: so there is 1 local model (see the bottom of the GUI) but I don't see it in the list. However, if I download a proper language model (say, `mistral-7b-v0.3`) the GUI shows both: Is this intended or is it a bug? Best, Alessio

comment.body: Seems like a valid bug though the filter options dont show up unless you download a large language model this is after downloading an embedding model this is after downloading a large language model

payload.description: iscrape is a powerful Python-based web scraper and dataset generator. It recursively crawls websites (handling redirects and subdomains), extracts content using crawl4ai and modern browser tooling, and distills the raw data into fine-tuning ready datasets (JSONL, Markdown, JSON) using LLM providers like Gemini or OpenAI.

release.body:

- Add independent Grid Mode and Flow Mode toggles
- Fix overlay to appear above menu bar and Dock  
- Clear modifier flags from mouse events for reliable clicks
- Add View Shortcuts button linking to SHORTCUTS.md
- Slim menu bar UI with right-aligned toggles
- Add custom volume icon to DMG

release.name: v1.0.0
release.body:
# NoMouse v1.0.0

ðŸŽ‰ **First release!** Keyboard-driven mouse control for macOS.

## Features
- **Grid Navigation** â€” Type 2 letters to jump anywhere on screen
- **Precision Mode** â€” Single-letter refinement for pixel-perfect positioning
- **All Mouse Actions** â€” Left, right, middle click + drag
- **Scroll Support** â€” âŒ˜ + Arrow keys
- **Movement Acceleration** â€” Hold arrow keys to speed up
- **Multi-Monitor** â€” Works across all displays
- **Menu Bar App** â€” Minimal footprint, no Dock icon

## Requirements
- macOS 13.0 (Ventura) or later
- Accessibility + Input Monitoring permissions

## Installation
1. Download `NoMouse.dmg`
2. Drag to Applications
3. Grant permissions when prompted
4. Press **âŒƒ Space** to activate

## Keyboard Shortcuts
| Key | Action |
|-----|--------|
| âŒƒ Space | Activate |
| A-Z + A-Z | Jump to cell |
| Return | Click |
| â‡§ Return | Right-click |
| Arrow keys | Move cursor |
| âŒ˜ + Arrows | Scroll |
| D | Toggle drag |
| Escape | Exit |
